svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - July 24 2021
July 24 2021

title: "Week in Ethereum News
July 24, 2021" date: "2021-07-24"
Eth News and Links
Mainnet execution layer
â€¢ Clients need to update after consensus issue found on Ropsten testnet, Geth included a transaction which OpenEthereum and Besu rejected;
updated client versions: Geth v1.10.6 Erigon 2021.07.04-alpha Nethermind v1.10.79
â€¢ Geth v1.10.6
â€¢ Erigon 2021.07.04-alpha
â€¢ Nethermind v1.10.79
â€¢ Latest core devs call . Notes from Tim Beiko : London upgrade date unchanged after consensus issue gasPrice field will be set to
maxFeePerGas and changes to effectiveGasPrice once mined, field to be removed next upgrade Focus on Proof of Stake testnets post London
â€¢ London upgrade date unchanged after consensus issue
â€¢ gasPrice field will be set to maxFeePerGas and changes to effectiveGasPrice once mined, field to be removed next upgrade
â€¢ Focus on Proof of Stake testnets post London
â€¢ Naming upgrades discussion with polls
â€¢ Access list transactions since Berlin upgrade : ~270k transactions, ~5% of potential gas space
â€¢ Chain history storage network first draft: provides on-demand availability of historical block headers and block bodies
â€¢ Storage layout proposal for state network
â€¢ Proposal for EEICALL opcode to execute bytecode over given Execution Environment Interface
EIPs/Standards
â€¢ EIP3664 : next generation game NFT
â€¢ EIP3670 : EOF - Code Validation
Proof of stake consensus layer
â€¢ Draft EIP3675 : Upgrade consensus to Proof-of-Stake
â€¢ Validators need to update their execution clients for the London consensus issue, validators running Prysm need to update Prysm
â€¢ Lighthouse client update: focusing on Altair upgrade, doppelganger support and networking overhaul
Layer2
â€¢ Reddit scaling Community Points using an Arbitrum rollup: starting with Rinkeby testnet then migrating to mainnet
â€¢ Celer cBridge v1.0 : instant token transfer between Ethereum, Arbitrum and selected sidechains
â€¢ StarkNet Alpha 1 : Layer1<>Layer2 messaging protocol and onchain data availability via state diff published to Ethereum
This newsletter is made possible thanks to Celer !
Celer cBridge v1.0 is now live on mainnet! Users are now able to use cBridge to instantly transfer tokens across Ethereum, Arbitrum,
Polygon and Binance Smart Chain, with many more side chain and layer-2 chain integrations planned for in the near future. Anyone can run a
cBridge node to join the cBridge Network and provide cross-chain and cross-layer liquidity while generating yields through transaction
fees.
Stuff for developers
â€¢ Hardhat v2.5.0 : Hardhat Network support for London
â€¢ Brownie v1.15.0 : Multicall context manager, Solidity 0.8 typed errors, EIP712 message signing, hardware wallet support, and Vyper
â€¢ Permit Singleton : meta transaction transfers for already deployed ERC20/721/1155 tokens via a singleton contract per network
â€¢ micro-eth-signer updated for London and Berlin
â€¢ abi-to-sol v0.3.0 : adds a web UI and improved support for older Solidity versions
â€¢ Ledger plugins to parse transaction fields and build custom displays for smart contracts
â€¢ Donâ€™t use spot price as an oracle
â€¢ Beginner tutorial: send transactions in React via useDapp
Security
â€¢ Thorchain exploit ~$8million; call to malicious contract can drain holders RUNE
â€¢ Array Finance exploit ~$500k, price manipulation drained the pool
â€¢ Alexâ€™s rescuer perspective of saving funds from a phishing scammer using an Ethereum burner and Flashbots
â€¢ SupDucks unrevealed on-chain metadata not private
â€¢ 3 month Secureum bootcamp for smart contract auditing
Ecosystem
â€¢ Georgios & Vitalik: Reorgs in Ethereum , prevention measure is to speed up Proof of Work switch off, less of an issue with Proof of
Stake as attack would require large portion of validators
â€¢ Flashbots Research on MEV post EIP1559
â€¢ Optimism experimenting with public goods funding using sequencing profits, first experiment is retroactive public goods funding
â€¢ NFT series retroactively supporting EIP1559 contributors (Disclosure: I supported)
â€¢ Ashton Kutcher asks Mila Kunis about Ethereum with special guest
â€¢ #ETH gains the Ethiopian flag as Twitter adds flags to 3 letter country code hashtags for the Olympics
â€¢ Ethereum.org Q3 roadmap
â€¢ EthCC mainstage videos
Enterprise
â€¢ Bank of Korea selects GroundX for CBDC pilot with ConsenSys as technical partner
Application layer
â€¢ Maker Foundation shutting down as MakerDAO is decentralized
â€¢ DAppNode governance token : airdrop with 3 year claimable stream
â€¢ Tweet storm list of DAOs & strategies for picking them
â€¢ PartyBid : protocol to pool funds for bidding in NFT auctions
â€¢ Intro to Axie Infinity and play to earn gaming model
â€¢ AutographNFT : use web2 IDs such as Twitter to autograph NFTs
â€¢ ZKNFT alpha : proof of concept NFT marketplace on zkSync
â€¢ PawNFT on Rinkeby: NFT-collateralized lending using active auction
â€¢ Run a local game of the Dark Forest
â€¢ Aave planning to build Twitter alternative on Ethereum
Regulation/business/tokens
â€¢ EU proposal to extend AML/CFT rules to entire crypto sector : service providers to conduct due diligence on their customers, anonymous
crypto asset wallets will be prohibited
â€¢ US Working Group on Financial Markets discussed stablecoins : act quickly on regulatory framework, recommendations expected in coming
months
â€¢ Taming wildcat stablecoins paper - Gorton (Yale) and Zhang (US Fed)
â€¢ USDC reserves : 61% cash and equivalents
â€¢ ETH, the worldâ€™s most valuable asset
General
â€¢ Detect NSO Groupâ€™s Pegasus phone malware , used to target activists, politicians and journalists
â€¢ Security analysis of Telegram, vulnerabilities disclosed in message reordering, encrypted message detection, plaintext recovery of
encrypted messages and attacker in the middle
â€¢ Chrome patches 8th zero day vulnerability this year, reports of exploit in the wild
â€¢ DuckDuckGo Email Protection beta : removes email trackers from @duck.com and unique private email addresses
Job Listings
â€¢ ðŸ§™ Defi marketing wizard , Float.Capital seeks ðŸ§™
â€¢ Props is hiring a Front End Blockchain Engineer
â€¢ Alejandro from Synthetix: smart contract engineer trainee via EthernautDAO
â€¢ Nethermind internship program
Want to reach people experienced with Ethereum? List your job here. $345 per line (~75 character limit including spaces), payable in ETH
(or 345 DAI or 345 USDC) to abcoathup.eth. Questions? abcoathup at-gmail
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @evan_van_ness and @abcoathup to get most of the weekâ€™s news in
real time.
Permalink for this weekâ€™s issue: https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-july-24-2021/
Dates of Note
Upcoming dates of note (new/changes in bold ) :
â€¢ July 25-31 - IC3 Blockchain Camp (virtual)
â€¢ July 26+30 - OpenZeppelin/ITBA free course for devs in Spanish
â€¢ July 30 - Sign in with Ethereum RFP deadline
â€¢ August 1 - applications close for Secureum auditing bootcamp
â€¢ August 4 - London hard fork
â€¢ August 12 - applications close for EF small grants for events
â€¢ Aug 27-29 - Edcon (Shenzhen/online)
